metadata.Description: Agricultural practices that sustainably increase productivity, resilience, and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

entities.Description: Groups of people who are socially, economically, or politically disadvantaged and face barriers to accessing resources and opportunities.
Access to affordable and sustainable energy solutions for smallholder farmers to improve agricultural productivity and livelihoods.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
Agricultural practices that sustainably increase productivity, resilience, and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

relations.Description: Climate-smart agriculture implements sustainable farming practices that reduce greenhouse gas emissions and promote climate resilience.
relations.Subject: climate-smart agriculture

relations.Description: Climate-smart agriculture funds research and development projects to improve agricultural practices and technologies for climate adaptation.
relations.Subject: climate-smart agriculture

relations.Description: Climate-smart agriculture focuses on climate change mitigation by implementing practices that reduce carbon emissions and enhance carbon sequestration.
relations.Subject: climate-smart agriculture

relations.Description: Climate-smart agriculture is implemented in rural communities to improve food security, livelihoods, and resilience to climate impacts.
relations.Subject: climate-smart agriculture

relations.Description: Climate-smart agriculture partners with local farmers to promote the adoption of sustainable and climate-resilient farming practices.
relations.Subject: climate-smart agriculture

relations.Description: Climate-smart agriculture contributes to the achievement of sustainable development goals, particularly those related to food security, poverty reduction, and climate action.
relations.Subject: climate-smart agriculture

relations.Description: Climate-smart agriculture monitors crop yields to assess the effectiveness of sustainable farming practices and identify areas for improvement.
relations.Subject: climate-smart agriculture

relations.Description: Climate-smart agriculture targets smallholder farmers to provide them with the knowledge, resources, and support needed to adopt climate-resilient farming practices.
relations.Subject: climate-smart agriculture
marginalized communities
relations.Description: Marginalized communities support energy access programs that provide clean energy solutions and resources.

relations.Subject: marginalized communities
relations.Description: Marginalized communities align their energy initiatives with the Sustainable Development Goals to promote sustainable and inclusive development.

relations.Subject: energy for smallholder farmers
relations.Description: Energy for smallholder farmers implements building standards that promote the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

relations.Subject: energy for smallholder farmers
relations.Description: Energy for smallholder farmers funds renewable energy projects to provide sustainable energy solutions.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: solar energy
relations.Description: Solar energy implements Energy Efficiency Policy by promoting the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

Crop diversification is a key component of climate-smart agriculture, which involves growing a variety of crops in a single area. This practice helps to enhance resilience to climate change by reducing the risk of crop failure and increasing overall productivity.
relations.Subject: crop diversification

relations.Description: Agroforestry is an important practice within climate-smart agriculture that involves integrating trees and shrubs with crops and livestock. It provides multiple benefits such as improved soil fertility, increased biodiversity, and enhanced climate resilience.
relations.Subject: agroforestry

relations.Description: Conservation agriculture is a key approach within climate-smart agriculture that promotes sustainable and resource-efficient farming practices. It involves minimizing soil disturbance, maintaining soil cover, and practicing crop rotation to improve soil health, water retention, and overall productivity.
relations.Subject: conservation agriculture

relations.Description: Precision agriculture is an advanced farming technique that utilizes technology and data to optimize crop production while minimizing resource inputs. It involves the use of sensors, GPS, drones, and other tools to monitor and manage crops with precision, leading to increased efficiency and reduced environmental impact.
relations.Subject: precision agriculture

relations.Description: Climate-resilient crops are specific varieties or species of crops that are bred or selected to withstand and adapt to the impacts of climate change. These crops possess traits such as drought tolerance, heat resistance, disease resistance, and improved nutrient efficiency, contributing to the overall resilience of agricultural systems.
relations.Subject: climate-resilient crops
